meanings.definition: To move with a rushing or swirling sound.
meanings.sent1: The wind was wooshing through the trees.
meanings.sent2: I heard the leaves wooshing in the breeze.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape was wooshing behind him as he flew.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to be wooshing by as we enjoyed ourselves.
meanings.sent5: The water was wooshing down the drain in a mesmerizing spiral.

meanings.sent1: The wooshing of the waterfall was deafening.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the distant wooshing of the cars on the highway.
meanings.sent3: The wooshing of the vacuum cleaner filled the room.
meanings.sent4: The wooshing of the waves against the shore was calming.
meanings.sent5: The sudden wooshing of the door opening startled me.
